thread.title: Soccer Lands 18 on Academic All-MAC List
thread.title_full: Soccer Lands 18 on Academic All-MAC List

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Soccer Lands 18 on Academic All-MAC List
text:
Soccer Lands 18 on Academic All-MAC List
The Eastern Michigan University soccer team matched the Mid-American Conference record with 18 players earning Academic All-MAC honors, as announced on December 5. These accolades recognize student-athletes with a minimum 3.20 GPA who participated in at least half their team's contests. Notable recipients include seniors Sophia D'Ambra and Meagan Lukowski, marking their third selection, alongside Sam Lenaghan. This achievement emphasizes the balance of athletic prowess and academic performance within the program.
By the Numbers- 18 student-athletes from Eastern Michigan made the Academic All-MAC list, tying for the most in conference history.
- 140 total student-athletes received the Academic All-MAC designation across the conference.
- Eastern Michigan has established itself as an academic leader in the Mid-American Conference.
- The program continues to attract high-achieving individuals who excel both on the field and in the classroom.
As the academic year progresses, Eastern Michigan's soccer team aims to build on this success, potentially increasing their number of recognized athletes. Continued focus on academic excellence could enhance future recruitment and retention of top-tier student-athletes.
Bottom LineThe record-setting achievement of 18 Academic All-MAC selections underscores Eastern Michigan's commitment to fostering both athletic and academic excellence, marking a significant milestone for the soccer program.
Read more at Eastern Michigan University Athletics
